data.title: HF Habs: - Official 2024 HFHabs Mock NHL Draft (COMPLETE)
data.meta_description: Ok, I usually hold an Early Bird draft a day after Trade Deadline, but the deadline was really late this year, and I was super busy. I figured just go right...
data.meta_site_name: HFBoards - NHL Message Board and Forum for National Hockey League
data.text:
Ok, I usually hold an Early Bird draft a day after Trade Deadline, but the deadline was really late this year, and I was super busy. I figured just go right into the Official HFHabs draft.

As far as options in trades go, they'll only be approved if the option already exists. For instance, a second turning into a 1st if a team makes final four is a 2nd. For an option that states team gets a 2nd instead of a 3rd if they make the playoffs will be a 2nd if that team is in a playoff spot.

I only allow 6 hours between picks before I auto. Check daily for your upcoming pick. You can send pick choices to me or other participants if you know you won't be available to select.

Picks can be made at any time, but 8 am -10 pm edt is when the clock runs. If someone picks at 11 pm, the next player has 6 hours from 8 am to pick.

There are 27 teams this year. I only merged a couple of teams that had few draft picks (like Boston & TB).

TEAMS:

Anaheim: @MasterMatt25

Arizona: @Vachon23

Boston/Nashville: @SOLR

Buffalo: @Treb

Calgary: @CheldishGamibno

Carolina: @le_sean

Chicago: @Mrb1p

Toronto: @A Loyal Dog

Vancouver/Vegas: @Twisted Sinister

Washington: @David Suzuki

DRAFT

The 4 division leaders are the last 4 picks. The 16 teams out of the playoffs are the top 16 picks. For instance, St. Louis has a better record than Pittsburgh, but the Pens are in a playoff spot and the Blues are not, so Blues pick ahead.

RULINGS:

1st Round

1. Detroit has the option of sending their own pick or Boston's pick to Ottawa from the Debrincat trade. I assume they will give the worst pick, which is Boston's.

2. Carolina keeps their 1st round pick and will give Pittsburgh a 2nd round pick from the Guentzel trade. Carolina has to make the SCF for the 2nd to become a 1st, which obviously hasn't happened.

2nd Round

1. In the 3 team trade that sent Provorov to Columbus, the Blue Jackets were given the decision to send their 2024 or 2025 2nd round pick to Philadelphia. The decision doesn't have to be made until after round one of the 2024 draft. Most teams prefer delaying to next year when it's a high pick in hopes that they'll be better the following year giving up a worse pick. Columbus will keep their 2nd round pick in 2024 for this draft.

2. In the Meier trade, NJD needed to make the Conference Finals in 2023 or 2024 for their 2024 2nd round pick to upgrade to a 1st round pick for SJS. NJD didn’t do that in 2023, and although they are not officially eliminated, they are not in a playoff position for this draft, so San Jose is given NJD 2nd round pick.

As far as options in trades go, they'll only be approved if the option already exists. For instance, a second turning into a 1st if a team makes final four is a 2nd. For an option that states team gets a 2nd instead of a 3rd if they make the playoffs will be a 2nd if that team is in a playoff spot as of tonight.

I only allow 6 hours between picks before I auto. Check daily for your upcoming pick. You can send pick choices to me or other participants if you know you won't be available to select.

Picks can be made at any time, but 8 am -10 pm edt is when the clock runs. If someone picks at 11 pm, the next player has 6 hours from 8 am to pick.
